title: I think conquerer managed to be unhealthier than fervor
body:
It can be prepared on non-champions (unlike fervor) and it gives you access to a great amount of true damage (unlike fervor).

Way back when I remember one of the counterpoints against fervor was that it could be kept passively by attacking any target (this is why people said it was unhealthy compared to say PtA), but is conquerer any different? If you're a melee champion it doesnt matter who you hit, you're getting conquerer reset. Fervor had been near perfectly balanced before it got axed, so I can't understand why it's so difficult to just swap out conquerer for fervor.

replies.body:
The real question is, do we really need either?
Any conqueror user can do well with either PTA, Lethal Tempo or Grasp, some wvwn have other options, like darius takeing hail of blades, and fleet foodwork is supprisingly has been buffed quite a bit for melees.
One of the main issues right befor conqueror was added has been bruiser struggling in top. However, alot of that has been them beeing terible in teamfights and that didn't change, and the other was haveing issues to win 1v1 vs tanks, and the main reason why they felt like they have no proper keystone was that all the starting stats were tied to the keystone, so going grasp ment not getting any agressive stats for the early laneing. 
Tanks have been nerfed directly and indirectly since then, bruisers have better midgame teamfighting as adc need longer to get online and 1v1 leads snowball harder, and starting stats are now split between primary and secundary rune-path, so i don't think conqueror really is needed atm, and **IF **bruisers would feel bad without it, one could finally allow people to choose startign stats independend of keystones, so i can get grasp and a mix of ad+as rather than beeing stuck with the scaleing health that is not to great when you want dominant laneing.

Not with FoB.

> She teamfights very well and has a ton of AOE damage.

Seriously? Are you seriously suggesting that it's okay for Riven not to be able to kill tanks because she out-teamfights them? Tanks completely invalidate Riven in teamfights so if she doesn't have sidelane pressure to be there earlier for a skirmish/catch then that's absolutely terrible!

> And with or without conqueror she will out scale tanks in a 1v1.

No. They can just clear the waves, walk away and use their superior teamfighting to win - or just turn with the help of their jungler. Riven needs Conqueror for the sidelane pressure.

I honestly don't understand your obsession with conqueror on riven. It's honestly not that good unless there are two tanks. Or a hyper tank and due to team comps you have to split into him. Comet, phase rush, klepto, aery, Aftershock, grasp, and spellbook are all good on her in specific matchups. Conqueror is honestly the most niche of all of them. And you should almost never run it into bruisers. Aftershock is better against Ren and Jax then conqueror is. Comet or phase rush against darius tryna and the like. I can get a list. 

Also jayce and Kennen are the only two ranged toplaners who consistently give riven trouble. She can build tabis against Quinn and basically ignore harrass and shove and roam. And hexdrinker completely nullifies Teemo. 

And no. Riven's Is not the epitome of unbalance. However there is a reason picking tanks is trolling ATM. They are completely useless all game long. They get beaten up early in lane due to shit tons of nerfs. They lose mid and late due to conqueror (where they already lost due to sustain and armor pen) (except orn, that guy was broken as shit in preseason) 

Conqueror is a problem. Toplaners never needed it. They needed tanks to not deal 50% of their hp at level 1 while entering lane with 300+ HP down. That was fixed. The patches right before conqueror came out tanks were just mildly too strong. Tiny nerfs to damage was all that was needed. 

Without conqueror we are still at a place where tanks maybe are strong. Which would actually force crit adc's back into the game to deal with them.  Altho they would STILL lose the splitpush post 15 minutes. And would rely on teamfighting. 

And as for riven's matchups. How hard she struggles in them is directly correlated to her skill. Chogath is an easy matchup. You simply don't fight him and outscale. He teamfights like garbage. All of his skills are hugely telegraphed behind extremely long cast times and the only thing he is good for is taking up space and flash ulting the adc. However riven can snowball the game way harder then chogath can. Unless she feeds him. 
Ya there are some matchups she struggles with. However Ren is probably the hardest ATM. But if you take Aftershock instead of conqueror it's extremely easy not to die. Which is the most important. 

I think you feel riven is worse then she is because your taking conqueror all the damn time instead of proper runes.

Way to ignore everything constructive I've said - - I am not interested in arguing about neither my nor your gameplay. 

> Why do you feel that tanks shouldn't be viable toplane? 

Because their gameplay is simply pushing while interacting as little as possible with their lane opponent -- Tanks are absolutely valuable to the game, however in toplane they have a terrible track record when it comes to game health. Champions like Maokai, Gragas, Sion, Nautilus etc. are all great champions - but whenever they are played top all they do is shove the wave while trying not to interact with their opponent.

There are some good tanks that deserve to be played top as they have (relatively) interesting trading patterns - such as Shen and Ornn, but they are definitely the minority.

> I strongly disagree, tanks are pretty good in toplane soloQ. I won't argue on the trading patterns. There is definitely work that could be done there. Neither am I a fan specifically of getting cc locked during a gank while the jungler kills me. However, these are problems which could be fixed. Wave clear could be reduced on champions like soon, malphite, and maokai and shields and healing could be tied behind interaction with the opposing laner forcing you to trade rather then gain passive Regen/shields. 

My biggest issue with the game really has nothing to do with this discussion. I do however maintain that riven (considering how she fairs in most bruiser matchups and considering her scaling) should have matchups where she struggles. She teamfights extremely better then other bruisers because of the sheer aoe damage she can do. While going even-beating them in lane. And only falling off post 2 items to most of them in the 1v1. And even then she has the tools to dictate the terms of engagement more often then not. 

That being said, if you want to play something strong against riven, you should have the option to grab a tank and be unkillable in lane. (IMHO riven should struggle with kill pressure on tanks, she shouldn't (nor should most toplaners) be worried about dying without jungle influence in a tank matchup) but that tank should be able to match her fairly effectively in a teamfight. However bringing cc and beef rather then damage.

If you want to splitpush against tank you should be grabbing Camille or Fiora and doing that. Not every champion should have the same path to victory as all of the other ones. Conqueror makes it so that every bruiser shits on tanks bar non past an item or two. That is not good balance.

Ok. Riven does ~struggle~ against tanks currently. However she scales a bit too hard against them in the side lane IMHO. This is entirely due to conqueror. Her hardest matchups are ones where she cannot kill them. And if they are able to kill her (like Darius with a lead) then she  gets repeatedly dove with little to no counterplay. However, in the reverse she does the same, so it seems a wash in that aspect. 

Take Cho vs riven. It's a ~hard~ matchup in the sense that if you simply try to take 1v1 you basically die, but the matchup is ~easy~ on the macro sense because Cho is not gonna be running down your towers like a mad man and has a ton less mobility. So she simply out manuevers him on the map. 

Riven also can struggle against any different champion at a specific point in the game. For ranged champions she gets poked to hell and back pre six. And she can even get wrecked after if they play her level six powerspike correctly. However she will eventually outscale those champions very hard. 
But with champions like Jax/irelia/Darius/Fiora she has the edge in the early game but has an extremely dificult time after they get two items unless she is very far ahead. Basically when they can survive her burst and DPS her down she can't really go toe to toe anymore. 


Tanks IMHO are decent in solo que assuming that the team with them can play around them. I personally think they should have their damage nerfed and their tankieness and utility buffed. Tanks should bring the best cc by far, while lacking also by far, damage. And they should have less bianary kits so they are more rewarding to master rather then simply having a extremely low skill floor comparatively. 

I did however look up on lolanylitics and the tanks in toplane who are performing decently ~50%~ have an extremely low playrate. 3% at the highest with most of them barely cresting 50%. That tells me that either they are secretly really strong and are only used by autofilled toplaners. Or that they are rather weak and the mains are struggling to hit 50% averages. It's hard to say for sure which. My personal experience as both playing tanks and playing against them is that they feel really weak. 

But I feel like riven should be picked to do well into fighter vs fighter matchups. And her win conditions should be to get an edge and translate that into strong teamfighting, rather then picking her into anything and being able to either teamfight or split. Champions IMHO should have distinct niches which they fill. And distinct power curves as well.

Ok this is where we probably disagree. And I think the reason we disagree may be because we come from different stances of the game. 

I am making my argument on what I consider to be 'good balance' whereas your making your based on the state of the game now. 

So to get it out of the way, I want the games to be longer so that late game actually exists and is a part of the game. The game was designed around being a 35-45 minute game and trying to shorten that without a full redesign from the ground up will inevitably result in bad balance. 
So my arguments about riven and any other aspect of balance is with that thinking in my mind. With that said, from a standpoint of long games I think conqueror is bad for riven, and the game in general, because tanks lose too hard late game (actual late game of 5-6 items) with it. Because they already lost without it. 

I will accept your assessment on tanks Is accurate as I frankly don't know. I don't have much more time to reply here but I don't want to point this out quick. 

When I said riven should do well into fighters I did not mean that she should counter them. Just that the matchup in a 1v1 before 2 items on even gold favored riven. Which puts pressure on her to get a lead and use that to impact teamfights where she is better then her lane opponent by nature of her kit. 

Her opponent has the counterplay to this by farming up and outscaling. (in a 1v1) and putting cross map pressure. And avoiding bad teamfights which riven is looking for. There should always be counterplay. But it should start at a micro sense. And end in a macro sense. They should both be two sides of the same coin.

I had a Garen with 9/0 against yasuo top lane. I had trinity, randuins, tabi, and thornplate.

For the first 15 levels I stomped him as you would expect anyone with 7 kills on their lane opponent.

My other teammates were chasing kills rather than objectives so the game got lengthened and Yasuo simply farmed for his PD+IE, and finally got his Bloodthirster.

With Bloodthirster, the Yasuo who I could get to half health in 1 Q+E earlier suddenly had such absurd self healing and damage output that he healed through both me and Rammus and killed me in 1v1 in 7 seconds flat.

Armor items are total garbage next to lifesteal abusing conqueror champs like yasuo/fiora/darius.

What's the point of doing well with a garbage early champ like garen, stomping lane, only for one item to turn a stomp into a raid boss.

1.  Damage always outscales defense.  Sucks but that's the game.

2.  It's not really your fault here.  Your team just let Yasuo get ahead (that's the annoying thing about Yasuo.  Even if he's behind, he can seem like he was never behind once he picks up a few kills mid game).  

I'm not saying Conquorer isn't a problem, I don't like it either.  But I don't think bringing fervor back will fix the original problems.  Fervor will just be used by the majority of fighters, from divers to juggernauts, to skirmishers.  That alone is bad design amongst the fighter class imo.

Do you know how math works?

If you hit with a 10% Max HP spell on a 1000 Max HP target, conqueror would deal 1000*(.1)*(.2) = 20 True Damage, Or 2% of their Max HP.

Now take that SAME 10% Max HP Spell on a 3000 max HP target, and conqueror deals 3000*(.1)*(.2) = 60 True Damage, Or 2% of their Max HP.

Both situations conqueror deals 2% of their HP.

So yes building Health does not directly counter it, as it has a work around due to the way it works (with certain champions/items).
